title: Administrative Manager Job at TalentSquare
content:
TalentSquare - Our client is a fast-growing children’s fashion brand dedicated to creating stylish, functional, and comfortable clothing for kids. With a strong retail footprint and expanding manufacturing capacity, the brand is on a mission to deliver high-quality apparel that supports children’s active lifestyles.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Administrative Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full time

Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	They are now seeking a dynamic and strategic Administrative Manager to ensure smooth day-to-day operations across their retail and production channels.
	This role is central to the business’s growth, offering the opportunity to shape operational processes, manage cross-functional teams, and contribute directly to company efficiency and performance.


Job Summary


	The Administrative Manager is responsible for overseeing the seamless functioning of all operational, logistical, and administrative activities across retail stores and manufacturing facilities.
	From inventory management to vendor coordination and facility oversight, the role is ideal for a proactive, data-driven professional who thrives in fast-paced environments and enjoys building systems that scale


Key Responsibilties


	Strategic Planning & Forecasting: Develop and implement systems for inventory forecasting, resource planning, and operations management.
	Facilities Oversight: Manage the upkeep, functionality, safety, and compliance of all retail and manufacturing locations, including lease agreements and infrastructure needs.
	Vendor & Procurement Management: Build and maintain relationships with suppliers, negotiate favorable terms, and ensure timely procurement of goods and services.
	Logistics & Fleet Management: Coordinate transportation schedules and optimize delivery timelines and routes for efficiency and cost-effectiveness.
	Data & Performance Analytics: Analyze operational data to identify trends, inefficiencies, and areas for improvement. Provide regular reports to leadership.
	Team Leadership: Supervise and mentor the administrative team, promoting a culture of accountability, collaboration, and continuous improvement.
	Compliance & Process Improvement: Ensure operational compliance with all legal, safety, and industry regulations. Continuously refine processes to enhance productivity.


What to Have


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Operations Management, or related field.
	4 - 5 years of proven experience in administrative or operations management; retail or manufacturing industry experience is a strong plus.
	Strong skills in inventory control, vendor negotiation, strategic planning, and logistics coordination.
	Excellent interpersonal and leadership skills; capable of managing diverse teams and external partners.
	A proactive mindset with the ability to work under pressure and prioritize effectively.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and Google Workspace (Excel/Sheets proficiency is a must).
	Highly organized with strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail.
	A genuine passion for contributing to a mission-driven brand that positively impacts children’s lives.


Salary
N400,000 - N500,000 monthly.

title: HR / Admin Assistant Job at Swift Consulting
content:
Swift Consulting, an Education, Human Resources and Management firm, is currently recruiting qualified and well experienced applicants to fill the position below:

Job Position: HR / Admin Assistant
Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Assist with recruitment processes, including posting job ads, scheduling interviews, and conducting initial screenings.
	Maintain employee records and ensure all HR documents are up-to-date and accurate.
	Provide administrative support to the HR department as needed.
	Respond to employee inquiries regarding HR policies and procedures.
	Assist in onboarding new employees and organizing orientation sessions.
	Help with payroll processing and employee benefits administration.
	Assist in organizing company events and training sessions.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, Psychology, or a related field.
	At least 2 years of experience in an HR/ Administrative role.
	Strong organizational and time management skills.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
	Ability to handle sensitive information with confidentiality and professionalism.
	Applicants must be eager to learn and develop career in HR.


Salary
N70,000 - N80,000 per month. 

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hireme@swiftconsulting.com.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Only qualified candidates will be contacted.

title: Relationship Manager Job at Pack ‘N’ Pay
content:
Pack ‘N’ Pay is a product of CIC Integrated Services LTD. CIC was created as a wholesale store that supplies food to offshore catering companies to feed the offshore workers. Pack ’N’ Pay was created as a product that would leverage technology to solve the problems of retailers and wholesalers. Pack ‘N’ Pay officially started operations on January 18th 2021 and launched her e-commerce website on March 1st 2021.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Relationship Manager

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a proactive, customer-focused Relationship Manager to join our team in Port Harcourt.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for building strong client relationships, managing customer interactions, and supporting sales efforts.
	This role requires excellent communication skills, a service-oriented mindset, and experience in handling customer accounts and order processing.


Key Responsibilities


	Serve as the primary point of contact for customers via phone, email, and in person.
	Provide accurate information about products and services.
	Direct customers to online tools and platforms where applicable.
	Handle and resolve customer complaints effectively and professionally.
	Demonstrate empathy and patience, especially when managing sensitive customer issues.
	Maintain and update customer records in the system.
	Collect, review, and analyze customer feedback to improve service delivery.
	Monitor and respond to customer reviews across platforms.
	Create and manage reports related to customer interactions and feedback.
	Build and maintain strong customer relationships.
	Conclude sales for online and walk-in customers.
	Check product availability and communicate updates to customers.
	Set up new customer accounts and ensure a smooth onboarding process.
	Book and process customer orders accurately and on time.


Requirements and Skills


	Bachelor’s Degree in Mass Communication, Linguistics, Business Administration, or a related field.
	2 - 4 years of relevant experience in customer service, sales support, or relationship management.
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
	Strong interpersonal and customer engagement abilities.
	Tech-savvy with experience using CRM or customer service software.
	Detail-oriented, well-organized, and able to multitask effectively.
	Young, smart, and vibrant, with a passion for customer satisfaction and relationship


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV and Cover Letter to: packnpayhr@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Infrastructure Engineer Job at Layer3
content:
Layer3 is one of the fastest growing network and security infrastructure companies in West Africa, providing award-winning services, including managed and cloud services, network security, IT infrastructure management, virtualization and mobile device management solutions. Our unique model integrates best-of-breed technologies from global leaders such as Juniper Networks, Blue Coat, Polycom, AirWatch, F5, Extreme Networks and VMware, coupled with our next-generation metro fiber networks, to offer unparalleled services and after sales support to some of the most demanding customers.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Infrastructure Engineer
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Summary


	The Infrastructure Engineer will be responsible for designing, building, and testing the private cloud infrastructure components comprising compute, storage etc.
	Also responsible for working to make sure the underlying private cloud infrastructure architecture and technical decisions support their cloud services, service tiers, and OLAs needed to meet business needs.


Responsibilities
What we will challenge you to achieve:


	Design and architect end to end validated solutions which represent real-world cloud provider implementations
	Function as the technical product expert for specific cloud provider solution areas
	Work closely with the cloud business unit providing input on & formal review of product functional specifications prior to development, provide feedback on releases and feature implementations
	Design, implement, and manage scalable and secure cloud infrastructure across public, private, and hybrid environments.
	Administer and support Linux-based systems, ensuring high availability, performance, and security.
	Deploy, configure, and manage Open-stack deployment such as Virtuozzo-based virtualization and container environments.
	Develop and maintain Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using tools like Terraform, Ansible, or similar.
	Collaborate with DevOps teams to automate deployment pipelines, CI/CD processes, and system monitoring.
	Provide technical expertise in containerization technologies including Virtuozzo, Docker, and Kubernetes.
	Integrate third-party services and APIs to enhance cloud platform capabilities.
	Create and maintain custom cloud product offerings and solutions tailored to business needs.
	Monitor system performance, conduct capacity planning, and perform root cause analysis on incidents.
	Implement and enforce security best practices across cloud and virtualized environments.
	Work with cross-functional teams to define cloud strategies and operational procedures.
	Ensure compliance with organizational standards and regulatory requirements (e.g., ISO, GDPR).
	Document system configurations, processes, and architectural decisions.


Requirements
What you need to have:


	First Degree in Engineering or Computer Science.
	3-5 years of experience as an Infrastructure Engineer.
	A strong understanding of IT automation, management, orchestration and cloud management platform capabilities driving IaaS, SaaS and PaaS is a plus.
	Strong hands-on expertise with OpenStack based virtualization Solutions
	Subject matter expert on virtualization solutions like Vmware, Proxmox etc.
	Strong understanding of storage solutions (ISCSI, NAS, SAN)
	Solid experience with Converged and Hyper-converged Virtualization Solutions.
	Strong understanding of backup and Disaster recovery solutions like Commvault, Veeam, Netbackup or Acronis.
	Proficient in Linux system administration (CentOS, Ubuntu, RHEL).
	Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, Digital Ocean, GCP is a plus
	Proven experience in cloud infrastructure management and DevOps practices is a plus
	Scripting skills in Bash is a plus.
	Familiarity with monitoring tools like Prometheus, Grafana, or Zabbix.
	Strong problem-solving, communication, and collaboration skills.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidate should send their Applications to: careers@layer3.com.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Supply Chain Expert Job at Runola Nigeria Limited
content:
Runola Nigeria Limited is a parent company with four subsidiaries (AdelooSuites, Runoplast, Runoclean, and RunoFeed)committed to delivering high-quality products and services to our customers. With a strong focus on innovation, efficiency, and excellence, we have established ourselves as a trusted name in the industry.

Our company operates across multiple locations, ensuring seamless production and service delivery while upholding the highest standards of professionalism. We value teamwork, integrity, and continuous growth, providing our employees with opportunities to excel in their careers.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Supply Chain Expert
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Supply Chain Expert is responsible for overseeing and optimizing the end-to-end supply chain operations of the organization.
	This includes procurement, logistics, inventory management, demand forecasting, supplier relationship management, and ensuring cost-effective, timely, and high-quality delivery of goods and services.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement supply chain strategies aligned with business goals.
	Analyze supply chain data and performance to identify areas for improvement.
	Coordinate logistics activities including shipping, warehousing, and distribution.
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Production, Sales, Finance) to align supply and demand planning.
	Oversee procurement activities, vendor selection, and contract negotiations.
	Manage inventory levels to ensure optimal stock without over/understocking.
	Monitor market trends and supplier performance to mitigate supply risks.
	Drive sustainability and cost-saving initiatives across the supply chain.


Qualifications and Skills


	Bachelor's Degree in Supply Chain Management, Logistics, Business Administration, or related field. A Master’s Degree or professional certification (e.g., CSCP, CPIM, CIPS) is a plus.
	Minimum of 2 – 5 years of experience in supply chain, logistics, or procurement roles.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
	Experience with ERP systems (e.g., SAP, Oracle, Microsoft Dynamics).
	Excellent negotiation, communication, and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to work under pressure and handle multiple priorities.
	Strong leadership and project management abilities.


Key Competencies:


	Strategic Thinking
	Operational Excellence
	Supplier/Vendor Management
	Risk Management
	Cost Control and Budgeting
	Data Analysis and Forecasting
	Process Optimization.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@runola.ng using "Supply Chain Expert Application" as the subject of the email.
